page.title: 14Landscape and Buildings
page.content: The present Clay Cutters Arms dates from 1606.Previously it was a Gentleman's House which later was made into 3 cottages where lived important men who worked in the Clay works.This building was destroyed in a fire and the present Clay Cutters was built.During the Civil War Charles 1 hid in the Clay Cutters to avoid Oliver Cromwell.Legend has it that the Clay Cutters is haunted by a Cavalier. The present building is made of cob,oak timbers and a thatched roof. It became a listed building in 1985.
